metadata.title: USN-6527-1 -- OpenJDK vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Carter Kozak discovered that OpenJDK, when compiling with AVX-512 instruction support enabled, could produce code that resulted in memory corruption in certain situations. An attacker targeting applications built in this way could possibly use this to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code. In Ubuntu, OpenJDK defaults to not using AVX-512 instructions. (CVE-2023-22025)  It was discovered that OpenJDK did not properly perform PKIX certification path validation in certain situations. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-22081)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6527-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  openjdk-11-demo - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-doc - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-jdk - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-jdk-headless - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-jre - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-jre-headless - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-jre-zero - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 openjdk-11-source - 11.0.21+9-0ubuntu1~22.04 No subscription required  openjdk-17-demo - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-doc - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-jdk - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-jdk-headless - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-jre - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-jre-headless - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-jre-zero - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 openjdk-17-source - 17.0.9+9-1~22.04 No subscription required
